words.def: someone who has committed a crime or has been legally convicted of a crime
outer bark of the cork oak
a lump or mass of hard consolidated mineral matter
(chess) the piece that can move any number of unoccupied squares in a direction parallel to the sides of the chessboard
an ancient Hebrew unit of capacity equal to 10 baths or 10 ephahs
the sound made by a pigeon
A Hebrew measure of capacity; a core or homer.
Any of several large, ferocious sea creatures, now especially the killer whale .
mythical bird of prey having enormous size and strength
a state in northwestern United States on the Pacific
